result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Marcus Brooks

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andre Marcus Brooks appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aileen Henry in court for Andre Marcus Brooks.  Attorney Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM. Testimony taken from Dr. Gust-Brey. DE rests.  Court finds that DE is not competent to proceed, but with appropriate medication treatment DE is likely to regain competency.  Proceed suspended.  DE committed to Dept of Health Services no longer than 9 months. DHS shall designate appropriate mental health institute - in patient treatment; KSD shall transport. Report ordered.  RH 12/16 930am.  Bond continued.  Competency hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing date changed to 9/22 3:15pm. State and Atty Henry notified by email this day.

Defendant Andre Marcus Brooks appeared by video IC.  Attorney Aileen Henry in court for Andre Marcus Brooks.  Attorney Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM. Comp report filed and received by parties. State stips to the findings in the report. DE does not agree with the findings and requests a contested hearing. Granted. CH 9/26 1pm.  Time limits waived by Atty Henry. State's witness may appear by zoom/zoom phone.  Bond continued.
Competency hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
CC and OFCE sent to WISCS and DHS

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Henry.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE has refused to cooperate with comp report and as a result the doctor has not been able to render an opinion. DE/Atty Henry does not have an objection to doctor's request.  DE will be transferred to Mendota or Winnebago for an inpatient eval.  State does not object.  CH set over to 9/14 10am.  Bond continued.
WFU re: no contact with DE

Criminal complaint and Comp exam sent to WISCS and DHS.
CR-205 sent to KCJ.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: 6113 25th Ave., Diane J.

03:02 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  Atty raises issue of Comp. - Court Order Comp. exam.  ts
and witness list filed by the State
